general_advisory: It is advised to monitor the pest population in crops regularly and take necessary actions as mentioned in the advisory for each crop.

advisory: Due to present cloudy weather, the population of Aphids may rise in Groundnut crop. To manage these pests at an early stage of infestation, spray neem-based pesticide (Neem Oil 15,000 PPM) @ 600 ml/acre by mixing in 200 liters of water. Use yellow sticky trap @ 8/acre. To manage these pests chemically, spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 40g/acre or Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80 g/acre or Spinosad 45% SC @ 75 ml/acre by mixing in 200 liters of water.

There will be chances of Sawfly infestation in Mustard crop. To manage this pest, irrigation should be done in the seedling stage (3-4 weeks) and manually collect and destroy grubs of sawfly in morning and evening hours. To manage Mustard sawfly, spray Ethofenprox 10% EC @ 200 ml/acre or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% E.C @ 400 ml/acre by mixing it in 200 liters of water.

Currently is the perfect time for planting garlic. Some varieties of Garlic include Agrifound white, Jamuna Safed (G-1), G-282, Agrifound Parvati (G-323) etc. In Garlic, 200-300 Kg cloves per acre is required for cultivation. Garlic cloves should be treated with Carbendazim @ 2 g per kg of seeds. A spacing of 15 cm between the rows and 8 cm within the rows is optimum for Garlic.

To manage aphids at an early stage, put 8 number of yellow sticky traps per acre. If the infestation is severe, then spray chemical pesticide Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 50-gram/acre or Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 50-gram/acre in 200 liters of water.
There are chances of Early leaf Blight disease incidence in potato crop. To control early leaf blight in potato, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @600 g/acre or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% W.P @ 400 g/acre.

Apply borax @ 4-kg/acre as soil application during transplanting in Cole crops to prevent Brown rot. If Borax was not applied during transplanting of seedlings, then spray Borax @ 2.5-gram/litre or Folibor/Solubor @ 1.5 gram/litre. Spraying of Boron micronutrient should be done after two weeks of transplanting and two weeks before curd formation.

To manage Leaf eating caterpillar pest biologically use Pheromone trap Spodolure @ 6/acre. Apply Bacillus thuringenesis @ 500 g/acre or Beauveria bassiana @ 500g/acre. For chemical control, spray Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% E.C @ 400 ml/acre or Lambda Cyhalothrin 5% EC @ 300 ml/acre during afternoon hours by mixing with 200 liters of water.
